alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Miami-Dade County through 315 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Everglades National Park to 6 miles northeast of Pa-Hay- Okee Overlook to near Royal Palm Ranger to 7 miles southwest of Turkey Point. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Homestead, Turkey Point, Homestead Miami Speedway, Black Point, Homestead General Airport, The Redland, Florida City, Homestead Base, Naranja, Princeton, Richmond West, Country Walk, Royal Palm Ranger, Leisure City, Shark Valley Obs Tower, Cutler Bay, Pa-Hay- Okee Overlook, Goulds, Homestead Bayfront Park and West Perrine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Miami. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.
